page.title: 16Horses at Whitehouse Farm
page.content: Mrs. Jackson, a horse trainer at Whitehouse Farm, has 9{thoroughbred {horses.} The fields are her father-in- law's. Not all the horses are hers, she just trains them. Her father-in law, also a trainer, shares a piece of land which they call "the gallop". Her husband and daughter help run the stables, with a stable boy. Their only machinery is a horse lorry. There is a set timetable: the horses are fed four times a day, on oats, a few racing nuts and hay. They are exercised every day, mostly galloping and over a few jumps. There are 8 stables, but in non- season most of the horses are turned out to grass and only 3 stables are used. The house was rebuilt four years ago since it was falling down. Mr.Jackson helps train, although he is in a wheel chair through a bad riding accident.
